verses.kjv: And Miriam and Aaron spake against Moses because of the Ethiopian woman whom he had married: for he had married an Ethiopian woman.
verses.web: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married; for he had married a Cushite woman.
verses.ct: Miriam and Aaron began criticizing Moses because he had married a Cushite woman.

verses.kjv: And they said, Hath the LORD indeed spoken only by Moses? hath he not spoken also by us? And the LORD heard it.
verses.web: They said, “Has LORD indeed spoken only with Moses? Hasn’t he spoken also with us?” And LORD heard it.
verses.ct: They said, "Has the LORD only spoken through Moses? Hasn't he spoken through us too?" The LORD heard what they said.

verses.kjv: (Now the man Moses was very meek, above all the men which were upon the face of the earth.)
verses.web: Now the man Moses was very humble, more than all the men who were on the surface of the earth.
verses.ct: (Now Moses was the most humble man on the face of the earth.)

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake suddenly unto Moses, and unto Aaron, and unto Miriam, Come out ye three unto the tabernacle of the congregation. And they three came out.
verses.web: LORD spoke suddenly to Moses, to Aaron, and to Miriam, “You three come out to the Tent of Meeting!” The three of them came out.
verses.ct: Without warning, the LORD spoke to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam: "All 3 of you, come out to the Tent of Meeting." So the 3 of them went out.

verses.kjv: And the LORD came down in the pillar of the cloud, and stood in the door of the tabernacle, and called Aaron and Miriam: and they both came forth.
verses.web: LORD came down in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the door of the Tent, and called Aaron and Miriam; and they both came forward.
verses.ct: The LORD came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the Tent. He called Aaron and Miriam forward, and they both stepped out.

verses.kjv: And he said, Hear now my words: If there be a prophet among you, I the LORD will make myself known unto him in a vision, and will speak unto him in a dream.
verses.web: He said, “Now hear my words. If there is a prophet among you, I, LORD, will make myself known to him in a vision. I will speak with him in a dream.
verses.ct: He said, "Listen carefully to what I'm about to say. When there is a prophet among you, I the LORD reveal myself to that person through visions and speak to them in dreams.

verses.kjv: My servant Moses is not so, who is faithful in all mine house.
verses.web: My servant Moses is not so. He is faithful in all my house.
verses.ct: But my servant Moses is different. He is faithful over everything in my house.

verses.kjv: With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the LORD shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?
verses.web: With him, I will speak mouth to mouth, even plainly, and not in riddles; and he shall see LORD’s form. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?”
verses.ct: I speak with him mouth to mouth — plainly, not in riddles — and he sees the very form of the LORD. So why weren't you afraid to speak against my servant Moses?"

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against them; and he departed.
verses.web: LORD’s anger burned against them; and he departed.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger burned against them, and he departed.

verses.kjv: And the cloud departed from off the tabernacle; and, behold, Miriam became leprous, white as snow: and Aaron looked upon Miriam, and, behold, she was leprous.
verses.web: The cloud departed from over the Tent; and behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. Aaron looked at Miriam, and behold, she was leprous.
verses.ct: When the cloud lifted from above the Tent, Miriam's skin had turned leprous — white as snow. Aaron turned to look at her and saw that she was covered with leprosy.

verses.kjv: And Aaron said unto Moses, Alas, my lord, I beseech thee, lay not the sin upon us, wherein we have done foolishly, and wherein we have sinned.
verses.web: Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord, please don’t count this sin against us, in which we have done foolishly, and in which we have sinned.
verses.ct: Aaron pleaded with Moses, "Please, my lord, don't hold this sin against us! We acted foolishly, and we have sinned.

verses.kjv: Let her not be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he cometh out of his mother’s womb.
verses.web: Let her not, I pray, be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother’s womb.”
verses.ct: Don't let her be like a stillborn baby whose flesh is already half eaten away when it comes from its mother's womb."

verses.kjv: And Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, Heal her now, O God, I beseech thee.
verses.web: Moses cried to LORD, saying, “Heal her, God, I beg you!”
verses.ct: Moses cried out to the LORD, "Please, God, I beg you — heal her!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, If her father had but spit in her face, should she not be ashamed seven days? let her be shut out from the camp seven days, and after that let her be received in again.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, shouldn’t she be ashamed seven days? Let her be shut up outside of the camp seven days, and after that she shall be brought in again.”
verses.ct: The LORD answered Moses, "If her own father had spit in her face, wouldn't she bear that shame for 7 days? Confine her outside the camp for 7 days, and after that she can be brought back in."

verses.kjv: And Miriam was shut out from the camp seven days: and the people journeyed not till Miriam was brought in again.
verses.web: Miriam was shut up outside of the camp seven days, and the people didn’t travel until Miriam was brought in again.
verses.ct: So Miriam was confined outside the camp for 7 days, and the people didn't move on until she was brought back in.

verses.kjv: And afterward the people removed from Hazeroth, and pitched in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.web: Afterward the people traveled from Hazeroth, and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.ct: After that, the people left Hazeroth and set up camp in the wilderness of Paran.
